definition: "water" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 85), occurring in 没, 法, 流 etc/see also 三點水|三点水[san1 dian3 shui3]
abbr. for 朝鮮|朝鲜[Chao2 xian3] Korea
imperial or royal court/government/dynasty/reign of a sovereign or emperor/court or assembly held by a sovereign or emperor/to make a pilgrimage to/facing/towards
high tide/high water/upsurge/climax/orgasm/chorus (part of a song)
tempest/wave (of popular sentiment etc)/craze or fad
Chaoshan, conurbation in the east of Guangdong 廣東|广东[Guang3 dong1]
Chaozhou prefecture-level city in Guangdong 廣東省|广东省[Guang3 dong1 sheng3]/Chaochou town in Pingtung County 屏東縣|屏东县[Ping2 dong1 Xian4], Taiwan
tide of thought/way of thinking characteristic of a historical period/Zeitgeist

sentences.english: Climate-induced storm surges will have similar impacts.
sentences.chinese: 氣候引發的暴風潮也會造成類似影響。

sentences.english: In this interview, Dr. Kase talks about baby boomers and leadership.
sentences.chinese: 在採訪中，凱瑟博士會討論嬰兒潮和領導能力。

sentences.english: Happy Spring tide with sea level, sea moon tide total health.
sentences.chinese: 春江花潮和海平面，海月亮潮整體健康。

sentences.english: Happy Spring tide with sea level, sea moon tide total health.
sentences.chinese: 春江花潮和海平面，海月亮潮整體健康。

sentences.english: On Thursday, the yen selloff gave other Asian currencies a breather.
sentences.chinese: 週四，日圓拋售潮讓亞洲其他貨幣鬆了口氣。

sentences.english: It's damp and cold. I think it's going to rain.
sentences.chinese: 空氣又冷又潮，我看是要下雨了。

sentences.english: There was damp everywhere and the entire building was in need of rewiring.
sentences.chinese: 到處都受了潮，整棟樓需要重新佈線。

sentences.english: My sister got her period for the first time during the day and they were celebrating.
sentences.chinese: 他們是在慶祝我的妹妹第一次月圝經來圝潮。

sentences.english: For baby boomers, these numbers drop to 50% and 44% respectively.
sentences.chinese: 在“嬰兒潮”人口中，數字分別跌至50%和44%。

sentences.english: At the same time, the baby boomer generation is aging and requiring health care.
sentences.chinese: 與此同時，嬰兒潮一代正在老去，需要醫療保健。

sentences.english: Driving this growth is a massive movie-theater-building spree.
sentences.chinese: 推動票房收入大增是大規模的電影院建設潮。

sentences.english: The cause of this boy boom has long flummoxed thinkers and scientists.
sentences.chinese: 男嬰潮現象使許多科學家與思考這問題的人抓破頭皮。

sentences.english: But the wave of closures and lay-offs throughout the industry was sobering.
sentences.chinese: 但是報業的關門潮和減員潮使得人們清醒了。

sentences.english: But the wave of closures and lay-offs throughout the industry was sobering.
sentences.chinese: 但是報業的關門潮和減員潮使得人們清醒了。

sentences.english: The fog clung to them, damp and chilly.
sentences.chinese: 霧裹住了他們，又潮又冷。

definition: tempest/wave (of popular sentiment etc)/craze or fad
to lift/to raise in height/to begin/upsurge/to set off (a campaign)
storm/violent commotion/fig. crisis (e.g. revolution, uprising, financial crisis etc)
to go with the tide/to blindly follow the crowd/to follow the trend
to appreciate (in value)/to increase in price
(of a tide) to ebb or go out
to become moist again/to revive (usually of sth bad)/resurgence
to invade/(of a storm etc) to strike/to hit
